desc: This topics course explores a Spanish peninsular cultural, literary, and/or linguistic theme from a base in Spain through analysis and discussion of texts, guest lectures, excursions to appropriate cultural sites, field research, and related experiential activities. Sample topics include: Christians, Jews and Muslims in Spain, and Spain's Autonomous Communities, Spain's Multilingual and Multicultural Landscape. Taught in Spanish. Prerequisite: SPAN 250.
name: Spain's Cult/Ling
notes: Not open to first-year students. This is an off-campus course. You will find this course listed in Studio Abroad under its course title.
title: Spain's Cultural and Linguistic Legacy
